document_title: Parasitic infections: Causes, signs, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_content:
Parasitic infection is a common disease often found in countries with tropical and subtropical climates caused by worms, tapeworms, fleas, lice, ticks, lice... living parasitically in humans through infectious routes. such as transmission through soil, skin, digestive tract, from animals to humans...
When parasites enter the human body, they suck human blood or nutrients to reproduce and develop, causing many harmful effects to the body such as damage to the liver, brain, lungs, kidneys, and malnutrition. , anemia... if not detected and treated promptly. (first)
Vietnam is a tropical country, with climatic conditions and living habits favorable for the development of parasites such as worm infections, flukes, malaria, etc.
